posts.post_content:
There are some who call me.......Tim.  
  
One of the most awesome EDH generals ever. He's green, so you can run [Seedborn Muse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Seedborn Muse) and fog every single turn. Many, many ways to keep him alive in these colors as well. I usually keep ![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) dedicated to him every single turn, in case I need to fog to save my arse. Sure, makes for a slower game, but it gives you plenty of breathing room if you get poor draws.
posts.html:

Posted By: Dr.Pingas (11/27/2011 11:39:23 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I've been playing magic for 12+ years and haven't seen this card until today. Pretty funny dude. Toss him in a deck with some ways to protect him (pemmin's aura + countermagic?) and he should be able to provide a soft lock. He's actually probably much better now then when he was originally printed....now that we've all seen first hand that Turbo-Fog decks can and do win - plus the land is a lot better.
  
   
He'd be a really annoying EDH general - especially in multi-headed team games where attack phases are shared.
posts.html:
I've been playing magic for 12+ years and haven't seen this card until today. Pretty funny dude. Toss him in a deck with some ways to protect him (pemmin's aura + countermagic?) and he should be able to provide a soft lock. He's actually probably much better now then when he was originally printed....now that we've all seen first hand that Turbo-Fog decks can and do win - plus the land is a lot better.

He'd be a really annoying EDH general - especially in multi-headed team games where attack phases are shared.

Posted By: Laguz (7/18/2010 12:53:45 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Repeatable [Fog](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fog)/[Holy Day](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Holy Day) each turn on a 2/2 three drop sounds very appealing despite the tricky three-color-cost.  
  
Yet if you're running a mono-green deck or don't want to bother with colors that much, you might consider using [Dawnstrider](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dawnstrider) instead, which can do the same, but at the typical Spellshaper cost which requires discarding.
posts.html:
Repeatable Fog/Holy Day each turn on a 2/2 three drop sounds very appealing despite the tricky three-color-cost.

Yet if you're running a mono-green deck or don't want to bother with colors that much, you might consider using Dawnstrider instead, which can do the same, but at the typical Spellshaper cost which requires discarding.

Posted By: teekasdragon (5/22/2011 7:33:49 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
That is the coolest card name, EVER!   
A guy named Angus would have been good enough.  
A guy named Mackenzie. would have been good enough.   
  
But a guy named Angus Mackenzie is just too good!  
  
And the best part, he's actually an awesome card.  
Any guy who can make every day a [holy day](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=holy day) deserves credit.  
Costly yes. Will need shroud, yes. but by turn four (probably earlier because of the green) even creatures with infinite power are irrelevant.   
  
Combo this guy with two things: [diplomatic immunity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=diplomatic immunity) or a twin on him, and [leyline of sanctity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=leyline of sanctity) on you and you are untouchable.
posts.html:
That is the coolest card name, EVER!
A guy named Angus would have been good enough.
A guy named Mackenzie. would have been good enough.

But a guy named Angus Mackenzie is just too good!

And the best part, he's actually an awesome card.
Any guy who can make every day a holy day deserves credit.
Costly yes. Will need shroud, yes. but by turn four (probably earlier because of the green) even creatures with infinite power are irrelevant.

Combo this guy with two things: diplomatic immunity or a twin on him, and leyline of sanctity on you and you are untouchable.
